@graph.name: Japanese Cheesecake
@graph.description: Light and fluffy, Japanese Cheesecake is a delicious gift for a real cheesecake lover.  It’s a melt-in-your-mouth combination of creamy cheesecake and airy soufflé.  A second (or more) serving is a guarantee!

video.name: How To Make Japanese Cheesecake (Recipe) スフレチーズケーキの作り方（レシピ）
video.description:
Light and fluffy, Japanese Cheesecake is a delicious gift for a real cheesecake lover.  It's a melt-in-your-mouth combination of creamy cheesecake and airy soufflé.  A second (or more) serving is a guarantee!

PRINT RECIPE ▶ http://bit.ly/JapaneseCheesecake2

Prep tim: 25 mins
Cook time: 85 mins
Serves: one 9" (23 cm) cake
 
Ingredients

15 g (1 Tbsp.) unsalted butter, for greasing the pan & parchment paper
6 large eggs (300 g without shell)
300 g (10.6 oz.) cream cheese
60 g (4 Tbsp.) unsalted butter
200 g (200 ml) heavy whipping cream
60 g (5 Tbsp.) granulated sugar
80 g (9 Tbsp.) cake flour
Zest from ½ lemon
30 g (2 Tbsp.) lemon juice (about half lemon)
100 g (8.5 Tbsp.) granulated sugar, for beating egg whites
2 Tbsp. apricot jam + 2 tsp. hot water, for topping

Equipment You'll Need:

9 inch (23 cm) cake pan (preferably 4 inch tall)
parchment paper
mixing bowls
a fine mesh strainer
a whisk
stand mixer or electric mixer
a large baking sheet


Instructions with step-by-step pics ▶ http://bit.ly/JapaneseCheesecake2

recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp unsalted butter ((for greasing the pan & parchment paper))
6  large eggs (50 g each w/o shell) ((10.6 oz, 300 g without shell))
¾ cup heavy (whipping) cream ((¾ cup + 4 tsp to be precise))
2 Tbsp lemon juice ((about ½ large lemon))
½ cup sugar ((8 Tbsp; for beating egg whites))

itemListElement.text: I shared more detailed info in the post, so please visit the blog post of this recipe.
itemListElement.name: I shared more detailed info in the post, so please visit the blog post of this recipe.

itemListElement.text: Cut parchment paper for the bottom and side of cake pan. You will need a 9” (23 cm) round paper for the bottom, one 4” x 30” (10 x 76 cm) paper for the side of cake pan, and two 2” x 30” (5 x 76 cm) paper strips which will be used for “transporting”.
itemListElement.name: Cut parchment paper for the bottom and side of cake pan. You will need a 9” (23 cm) round paper for the bottom, one 4” x 30” (10 x 76 cm) paper for the side of cake pan, and two 2” x 30” (5 x 76 cm) paper strips which will be used for “transporting”.

itemListElement.text: Grease the cake pan and parchment paper (for bottom and sides) with butter (15 g). You don't need to use all of it.
itemListElement.name: Grease the cake pan and parchment paper (for bottom and sides) with butter (15 g). You don't need to use all of it.

itemListElement.text: Place the 2 “straps” criss-cross on the bottom of the cake pan. Then place the bottom and side parchment paper. The grease side of the 9” (23 cm) paper should face up, and face in on the 4” x 30” (10 x 76 cm) paper.
itemListElement.name: Place the 2 “straps” criss-cross on the bottom of the cake pan. Then place the bottom and side parchment paper. The grease side of the 9” (23 cm) paper should face up, and face in on the 4” x 30” (10 x 76 cm) paper.

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF (180ºC). You will be baking at 320ºF (160ºC) but when you open the oven to place the cheesecake you’ll lose some heat, so we’ll start off a bit higher.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 350ºF (180ºC). You will be baking at 320ºF (160ºC) but when you open the oven to place the cheesecake you’ll lose some heat, so we’ll start off a bit higher.

itemListElement.text: Please note that it is very important that ingredients are all measured before starting. Separate the 6 eggs into egg yolks and egg whites. Refrigerate the egg whites.
itemListElement.name: Please note that it is very important that ingredients are all measured before starting. Separate the 6 eggs into egg yolks and egg whites. Refrigerate the egg whites.

itemListElement.text: Set a medium saucepan filled with 2” (5 cm) water and bring to simmer. Add cream cheese (300 g), unsalted butter (60 g), heavy whipping cream (200 ml), and granulated sugar (60 g) in a large bowl. Put the bowl over the saucepan.
itemListElement.name: Set a medium saucepan filled with 2” (5 cm) water and bring to simmer. Add cream cheese (300 g), unsalted butter (60 g), heavy whipping cream (200 ml), and granulated sugar (60 g) in a large bowl. Put the bowl over the saucepan.

itemListElement.text: Using a silicone spatula, mash the cream cheese and butter. Once they are melted, use whisk to blend everything together. Remove from the heat.
itemListElement.name: Using a silicone spatula, mash the cream cheese and butter. Once they are melted, use whisk to blend everything together. Remove from the heat.

itemListElement.text: In the warm cream cheese mixture add 6 egg yolks, one yolk at a time while whisking. Make sure each egg yolk blended well with the mixing before adding the next one.
itemListElement.name: In the warm cream cheese mixture add 6 egg yolks, one yolk at a time while whisking. Make sure each egg yolk blended well with the mixing before adding the next one.

itemListElement.text: Using a fine-mesh strainer, sift cake flour (80 g) into the batter. Whisk and blend together.
itemListElement.name: Using a fine-mesh strainer, sift cake flour (80 g) into the batter. Whisk and blend together.

itemListElement.text: Then pass the batter through the same fine mesh strainer to a clean large bowl, creating the silky texture for the batter.
itemListElement.name: Then pass the batter through the same fine mesh strainer to a clean large bowl, creating the silky texture for the batter.

itemListElement.text: Zest half of a lemon into the batter. Make sure you only zest the yellow part, not the bitter white part. Then squeeze half lemon into a small bowl. Measure lemon juice (30 ml) and add to the batter. Whisk well to blend and set aside.
itemListElement.name: Zest half of a lemon into the batter. Make sure you only zest the yellow part, not the bitter white part. Then squeeze half lemon into a small bowl. Measure lemon juice (30 ml) and add to the batter. Whisk well to blend and set aside.

itemListElement.text: Put the baking sheet inside the oven and pour hot water until half way or 1 inch deep. Close the oven.
itemListElement.name: Put the baking sheet inside the oven and pour hot water until half way or 1 inch deep. Close the oven.

itemListElement.text: Add cold egg whites into a large clean mixing bowl (of the stand mixer). Make sure there is no oil or water in the bowl. If you have space in your refrigerator, I highly recommend keeping the mixing bowl cold until you’re ready to use it. Start whisking on medium speed (speed 4) until the egg whites become opaque, foamy, and bubbly, about 2 minutes. Then slowly add 100 g granulated sugar, ⅓ portion at a time while the mixer runs.
itemListElement.name: Add cold egg whites into a large clean mixing bowl (of the stand mixer). Make sure there is no oil or water in the bowl. If you have space in your refrigerator, I highly recommend keeping the mixing bowl cold until you’re ready to use it. Start whisking on medium speed (speed 4) until the egg whites become opaque, foamy, and bubbly, about 2 minutes. Then slowly add 100 g granulated sugar, ⅓ portion at a time while the mixer runs.

itemListElement.text: Once all the sugar has been added, increase the mixer speed to high (speed 8-9) and beat the egg whites until “soft” to “medium” peaks. When lift the whisk, the egg whites shouldn’t fold ribbons (drizzle) anymore. When you turn your whisk upside down, the egg whites should cling to the whisk and hold their shape for a few seconds, but then start to flop over.
itemListElement.name: Once all the sugar has been added, increase the mixer speed to high (speed 8-9) and beat the egg whites until “soft” to “medium” peaks. When lift the whisk, the egg whites shouldn’t fold ribbons (drizzle) anymore. When you turn your whisk upside down, the egg whites should cling to the whisk and hold their shape for a few seconds, but then start to flop over.

itemListElement.text: Using a whisk, mix in ⅓ of egg whites into the cream cheese mixture until incorporated. Then gently fold in another ⅓ into the mixture.
itemListElement.name: Using a whisk, mix in ⅓ of egg whites into the cream cheese mixture until incorporated. Then gently fold in another ⅓ into the mixture.

itemListElement.text: Lastly, pour the mixture back into the mixer bowl (with ⅓ of egg whites still in it) and fold in very gently.
itemListElement.name: Lastly, pour the mixture back into the mixer bowl (with ⅓ of egg whites still in it) and fold in very gently.

itemListElement.text: Pour the mixture into the baking pan in all at once, avoiding air pockets while pouring. Tap the cake pan a few times on the kitchen counter to release any air pockets in the batter.
itemListElement.name: Pour the mixture into the baking pan in all at once, avoiding air pockets while pouring. Tap the cake pan a few times on the kitchen counter to release any air pockets in the batter.

itemListElement.text: Place the cake pan into the baking sheet that’s already in the oven. Reduce the oven temperature to 320ºF (160ºC) and start baking for 70-75 minutes. Then, reduce the oven temperature to 300ºF (150ºC) and bake for another 10 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the skewer inserted comes out clean. For a convection oven, reduce cooking temperature by 25ºF (15ºC).
itemListElement.name: Place the cake pan into the baking sheet that’s already in the oven. Reduce the oven temperature to 320ºF (160ºC) and start baking for 70-75 minutes. Then, reduce the oven temperature to 300ºF (150ºC) and bake for another 10 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the skewer inserted comes out clean. For a convection oven, reduce cooking temperature by 25ºF (15ºC).

itemListElement.text: Turn off the oven and leave the oven door ajar for 15-20 minutes with the cake inside. If you take the cake out immediately, the sudden change of temperature could cause the cake to shrink or collapse. You want the cake to slowly shrink down to half the height, roughly from 4 inches to 2 inches. Remove the pan from the oven. Gently pull out the cake using the 2 parchment paper straps (with another set of hand).
itemListElement.name: Turn off the oven and leave the oven door ajar for 15-20 minutes with the cake inside. If you take the cake out immediately, the sudden change of temperature could cause the cake to shrink or collapse. You want the cake to slowly shrink down to half the height, roughly from 4 inches to 2 inches. Remove the pan from the oven. Gently pull out the cake using the 2 parchment paper straps (with another set of hand).

itemListElement.text: Remove the parchment paper around the cake (leave the bottom one). Combine apricot jam (2 Tbsp) and hot water (2 tsp) in a small bowl. Brush the apricot mixture over the top of the cheesecake. Let cool to room temperature.
itemListElement.name: Remove the parchment paper around the cake (leave the bottom one). Combine apricot jam (2 Tbsp) and hot water (2 tsp) in a small bowl. Brush the apricot mixture over the top of the cheesecake. Let cool to room temperature.

itemListElement.text: You can serve the cake at room temperature (fluffiest!) or chill the cake for 1-2 hours before serving.
itemListElement.name: You can serve the cake at room temperature (fluffiest!) or chill the cake for 1-2 hours before serving.

itemListElement.text: You can store the cake in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days or in the freezer for 3-4 weeks. Defrost the cake overnight in the refrigerator. The cold cheesecake is dense, so leave it at the counter till chilled/room temperature before serving.
itemListElement.name: You can store the cake in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days or in the freezer for 3-4 weeks. Defrost the cake overnight in the refrigerator. The cold cheesecake is dense, so leave it at the counter till chilled/room temperature before serving.
